page.title: 09Recreation (cont)
page.content: People in the area are enthusiastic gardeners, it is unusual to see an untidy garden. The old gardens of the village benefit from the tree planting of the last century + there are some magnificent copper beech and walnut trees remaining. The soil varies clay, gravel to alluvium by the river, mostly neutral pH thus a wide variety of plants are grown. Snowdrops are especially prolific, the double in the Old Vicarage, many local varieties of daffodil, a fine red paeony, dark blue iris, orange + yellow crown imperials, primroses + michaelmas daisy with dark eye.More unusual a fine tree Paeony was at Church Cottages + an Eremurus Omega (Jubilee Rd). An Acer Brillian- tissumum brightens Chuch Rd. in the Spring. Most gardens grow some vegetables + at Carib (Jubilee Rd) the vegetable garden is perfect.
